ovdesc.p: The Security Open Order facility is the application to be used for passing Limit Orders and Market instructions between the Portfolio Management Department and the Dealing Department.
It can be utilised in several different ways.

1) It can be used by a Banks Dealing Department to store all unexecuted limit orders or ordinary market instructions received from either their Back Office (Securities Administration/Portfolio Management or indeed direct from their Clients.
2) It can therefore be used as a link between Back Office and Dealers where the Account Officer has received Buy/Sell Instructions from his client and wishes to inform / instruct the Dealer.
3) It is also conceivable that where a client has direct access via a terminal to his Portfolio account he would use this facility to pass on instructions regarding his positions.
However used this Sub System will allow the inputter to enter Buy or Sell Instructions against a particular stock at a certain price by a specified date in whatever currency he wishes.

The authorised Security Open Order creates a Trade Open Order for the Dealer at which level he either partially or completely fills the transaction. When entered this automatically creates a Sec.Trade in Hold Status which ideally the Back Office would pick up and finalise. This Security Trade would contain the original Security Open Order reference number.

The validation on the ORDER.DATE field in this SEC.OPEN.ORDER application can be controlled to a certain extent by the User.
